title: Some Investors Find Stability in SPACs
sub_head: Mania for blank-check companies and subsequent selloff has created what some see as an alternative to short-term bonds
body:
Shares of special-purpose acquisition companies have lost their luster for those who recently saw them as a ticket to fast riches. That is good news for a different group of investors, who treat them as an alternative to bonds.
Known on Wall Street as SPAC arbitrage, the trade has become turbocharged of lateâ€”thanks in equal parts to the day-trader-fueled craze for special-purpose acquisition companies that materialized late last year and the more-recent slump in SPAC demand.
